With peak torque exceeding 380 Nm and the ability to identify materials and shapes in real-time, GR-2 is deployed at SAIC-GM automotive facilities for precision manufacturing. With 6 kg payload capacity per arm at full extension and the ability to handle heavy tools for drilling and riveting, TALOS is used by leading research institutions including Inria. Featuring full torque sensor feedback in all joints, 2 kHz control latency, and comprehensive ROS/ROS2 support, TALOS is ideal for AI, machine learning, and locomotion research.

Capable of emulating over 60 facial expressions with stunning realism, Ameca can blink, yawn, smile, and react naturally to personal space. With binocular cameras, facial recognition, and lifelike movements, Ameca is popular in exhibitions, research labs, and media productions globally for entertainment, education, and customer engagement.

With 60+ facial expressions powered by 30 motors in the head, Sophia made history as the first robot granted citizenship (Saudi Arabia, 2017) and serves as the UN Development Programme's first Innovation Champion. Powered by Hanson AI SDK with Intel RealSense cameras, Sophia represents the cutting edge of social robotics and human-robot interaction.

With LTE connectivity, Aibo can recognize up to 100 faces, respond to over 50 voice commands, and learn customizable tricks. Equipped with dual cameras, four microphones with beamforming, and comprehensive sensor suite, Aibo has been a pioneer in consumer robotics since 1999, offering adaptive personality that evolves through interaction.

description: Xiaomi CyberDog 2 is a consumer-grade biomimetic quadruped robot redesigned to resemble a Doberman, weighing only 8.9 kg. Powered by NVIDIA Jetson Xavier NX AI supercomputer with 19 advanced sensors including LiDAR, depth camera, and ToF sensors, CyberDog 2 achieves sophisticated environmental perception. With proprietary CyberGear micro-actuators, it performs complex maneuvers like continuous backflips and fall recovery. Features mobile app, voice control, and XiaoAI smart home integration. Originally priced at CNY 12,999 (~$1,789), available for $3,000 internationally.

name: CyberOne
keyFeatures: 21 degrees of freedom for natural movement
Mi-Sense AI system for emotion recognition
Upper limb actuator: 500g weight, 30 Nm torque

supplierReliability.trackRecord: Xiaomi unveiled CyberOne in August 2022 as technology demonstration. Major consumer electronics company with extensive AI and IoT expertise, showcasing humanoid robotics capabilities.

description: Xiaomi CyberOne is a full-size humanoid robot unveiled in August 2022, standing 177 cm tall and weighing 52 kg. Featuring 21 degrees of freedom with 0.5ms response time, CyberOne showcases advanced AI capabilities through Mi-Sense system, recognizing 85 environmental sounds and 45 human emotions. Each upper limb actuator weighs only 500g while delivering 30 Nm torque, enabling 1.5 kg grip strength per hand. Equipped with curved OLED display, 3D space perception, and sophisticated bipedal control algorithm. Currently a research prototype demonstrating Xiaomi's humanoid robotics capabilities, not available for commercial purchase.

name: Pepper
keyFeatures: Emotion recognition through facial expressions and voice tones
19 degrees of freedom for natural movement
Recognizes 15 languages including English, French, Spanish, German
10.1-inch tablet on chest for information display
Two HD cameras and 3-D depth sensor for perception
12 hours battery life on 30Ah Li-ion battery
Supports Python, C++, Java, JavaScript, and ROS

aiFrameworksSupported: 20+ software engines for awareness, motion, dialogue

supplierReliability.trackRecord: Introduced in Japan in June 2014, manufactured until 2020. Production paused June 2021 due to weak demand. Aldebaran Robotics (manufacturer) entered receivership in June 2025. Despite discontinuation, Pepper was pioneering social robot deployed globally in retail, banking, and education.

description: SoftBank Pepper is a pioneering social humanoid robot designed for human interaction in retail, banking, and education sectors. Standing 121 cm tall with 19 degrees of freedom, Pepper reads emotions through facial expressions and voice tones using advanced AI. Equipped with dual HD cameras, 3-D depth sensor, 4 microphones, and comprehensive sensor suite. Features 10.1-inch chest tablet, recognizes 15 languages, and supports Python, C++, Java, JavaScript, and ROS. Introduced in 2014 with production until 2020, Pepper pioneered commercial service robots at scale despite discontinuation in 2021.

name: NAO
keyFeatures: 25 degrees of freedom for natural movement
Intel ATOM 1.9GHz quad-core processor with 4GB RAM
2 high-resolution cameras for face and object recognition
2 prehensile hands with capacitive touch sensors
Fully open and programmable with NAOqi OS
Supports Python, C++, JavaScript, and visual tools like Choregraphe

softwareEcosystem.openSourceRepos: NAO SDK and extensive documentation available
softwareEcosystem.apiDocumentationQuality: Excellent - comprehensive SDK with tutorials and community support

supplierReliability.postSalesSupport: SoftBank Robotics support, extensive online resources and community
supplierReliability.trackRecord: NAO launched in 2006, V6 introduced June 2018. As of 2024, over 13,000 units deployed in 70+ countries in education, research, healthcare, and therapy. Aldebaran (manufacturer) entered receivership June 2025, raising uncertainty over future support despite NAO's established presence.

description: SoftBank NAO is a 58cm humanoid robot designed for education, research, healthcare, and therapy applications. With 25 degrees of freedom powered by Intel ATOM 1.9GHz quad-core processor, NAO performs natural movements and interactions. Features 30 sensors including dual HD cameras for face recognition, 4 omnidirectional microphones, and prehensile hands with touch sensors. Fully programmable through NAOqi OS with Python, C++, JavaScript, and visual Choregraphe tool. Fluent in 20+ languages with over 13,000 units deployed in 70+ countries since 2006. V6 model introduced 2018, remains leading educational robotics platform despite manufacturer's 2025 receivership.
